intro: Calycacanthus magnusianus, commonly known as the Magnusian's calycacanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the family Calycanthaceae, which includes other fragrant flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough or hairy texture.
